description: In 1990, the term Two-Spirit was coined in Winnipeg by Elder Myra Laramee, who proposed its use during the Third Annual Inter-Tribal Native American, First Nations, Gay, and Lesbian American Conference.
Since 1992, there have been Two-Spirit groups that participate in Windsor Pride.
In 1995, the Two-Spirit Circle was founded, and held here every third Sunday of the month at 2pm.

In 2011, the Two-Spirit Group of Windsor was founded by Conni Ma'iingan. Three years later, the name was changed to Two-Spirit Circle of Windsor. The name was once again changed in 2021, to its current title: 2SLGBGTQI+ Circle of Windsor-Essex.
